definition: lit. to hang upside down/fig. topsy-turvy and inequitable, e.g. manufacturing and trading costs exceed the sale price (of some goods)/to borrow more than one can ever repay
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)

sentences.english: Four bats are hanging in back attics .
sentences.chinese: 四只蝙蝠正在阁楼顶上倒挂着。

sentences.english: Stick bombs hung handle down from their belts.
sentences.chinese: 手榴弹倒挂在每人的束身皮带上，弹柄朝下。

sentences.english: Office of the top milk- hung upside down, the length and breadth, the water dropping, pleasant - sounding.
sentences.chinese: 厅顶乳石倒挂，星罗棋布，水珠滴落，悦耳动听。

sentences.english: Peter was crucified upside down on an x-shaped cross.
sentences.chinese: 彼得是倒挂在十字架上殉道的。

sentences.english: Hanging by his feet from the tree next to the car was the dead body of Ned.
sentences.chinese: 内德尸体的脚倒挂在车旁边的树上。

sentences.english: Tom scored with a spectacular bicycle kick in the third minute.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆在第三分钟以一记精彩的倒挂金钩得分。

sentences.english: The picture was hung upside down…
And "Hey." My face swelling hot and full of blood, I'm hanging upside down.
sentences.chinese: 我的脸部开始充血，又红又涨，我在窗户外倒挂着。

sentences.english: Snape raised his eyes to the upside down face.
sentences.chinese: 斯内普抬起眼睛看着那张倒挂的脸。

sentences.english: A little monkey with two feet firmly hooked branches, upside down.
sentences.chinese: 一只小猴子用两只脚紧紧钩住了树枝，倒挂下来。

sentences.english: These small animals can suspend from the branches by their tails.
sentences.chinese: 这些小动物可以用尾巴将自己倒挂在树枝上。

definition: lit. to hang upside down/fig. in dire straits
to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
to chop sb in half at the waist (capital punishment)/to cut sth in half/to reduce sth by a dramatic margin/to terminate/to cut short
